byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin contributed reporting from Washington, and Nick Corasaniti from Lynchburg, Va.
byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and MAGGIE HABERMAN

abstract: Sen Ted Cruz becomes first Republican to declare himself candidate in 2016 presidential election, announcing in speech at Liberty University in Lynchburg, Va; is first-term senator known for rubbing people wrong way because of his ambition; people who have known Cruz for years say they have been surprised by his emergence as Tea Party firebrand after having been practical, Ivy League-educated lawyer and Republican insider.
lead_paragraph: The Republican senator from Texas, a Tea Party favorite who declared himself a presidential candidate on Monday, became known as an ambitious upstart who rubbed even some fellow Republicans the wrong way.

headline.main: Ted Cruz, an Ambitious Conservative With Sharp Elbows
headline.print_headline: Cruz Defined as Ambitious and Tactical

snippet: The Republican senator from Texas, a Tea Party favorite who declared himself a presidential candidate on Monday, became known as an ambitious upstart who rubbed even some fellow Republicans the wrong way.
